meanings.definition: To expose to danger or harm.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the gate open could endanger the safety of the animals.
meanings.sent2: Speeding on the road can endanger the lives of others.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to bring an umbrella might endanger you getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring warning signs can endanger your well-being like walking blindfolded.
meanings.sent5: Playing with fire can endanger your fingers getting burned.

meanings.definition: To put at risk of injury or loss.
meanings.sent1: Not wearing a seatbelt can endanger your life in a car accident.
meanings.sent2: Leaving valuables unattended may endanger them being stolen.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much candy could endanger your teeth getting cavities.
meanings.sent4: Procrastinating on assignments can endanger your grades slipping away.
meanings.sent5: Leaving the window open might endanger your belongings being blown away.
